page.title: 01Haslingden..an impression
page.content: {Haslingden}is situated in north-east {Lancashire.}It is comprised of mainly fields and hills. There two residential areas, part of{Haslingden and{Rising Bridge,}a small village. The area is to the north of{Manchester and is joined to the national motorway network by the{M66.}The area' s railway closed in the 1960's. There are quite a few evergreen woods and lots of farms. A few dis-used cotton mills can also be found. The land is mainly used for sheep farming. The area also has factories and an industrial estate. It has a by-pass and lots of new roads. In the area there is also Winfield's, a large shoe shop, combined with clothing, floor covering and a cafeteria. In the built up area there are new houses but stone terraced housing is most common.
